visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a parallel coordinates plot with the following specifications: Chart type: spline, Chart title: 'Marathon set', Axes and labels styling: Custom colors for axes and labels, Data series: Data fetched from 'https://www.highcharts.com/samples/data/marathon.json', Custom colors: ['rgba(11, 200, 200, 0.1)'], Additional configurations: Parallel coordinates enabled, parallel axes with line width of 2, tooltip formatting, and accessibility settings.

axis.yAxisDescriptionPlural: The chart has 7 Y axes across the chart displaying Training date, Miles for training run, Training time, Shoe brand, Running pace per mile, Short or long, and After 2004.

visualization_code.series: data.map(function (set, i) { return { name: 'Runner ' + i, data: set, shadow: false }; })

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a parallel coordinates plot using the 'spline' chart type. The chart is titled 'Marathon set' and includes detailed accessibility settings for the axes. The plotOptions section disables series animations and markers, ensuring a clean visualization. The tooltip is formatted to display series names and formatted values. The xAxis is categorized to represent different training metrics, while the yAxis is configured with various types and formats to handle different data types. The series data is dynamically mapped from the fetched JSON data, with each series named 'Runner [i]' and assigned the corresponding data set. Custom colors are applied to the series, and additional configurations enable parallel coordinates with specific axis styling.
